Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with Case 1: Activities in order: Application Received → Credit Check → Risk Assessment → Loan Decision (Approved) → Inform Applicant → Finalize Documentation → Close Case. Looking at the sequence, it follows the exact order required by the normative constraints. Each step is done in the correct sequence, and after approval, documentation is finalized before closing. No issues here.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Case 2: Activities: Application Received → Risk Assessment (no Credit Check before) → Credit Check → Loan Decision (Rejected) → Finalize Documentation (after rejection) → Close Case. The first thing I notice is that Risk Assessment happened before Credit Check. According to the normative constraints, Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment. This is a clear violation.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Case 2: Also, after the rejection, they tried to finalize documentation, which isn't allowed. So two normative violations here.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 3: Activities: Application Received → Credit Check (2 days later) → Risk Assessment → Loan Decision (Approved) → Inform Applicant (2 days after decision) → Finalize Documentation → Close Case. No missing steps in the sequence. Credit Check came after Application, then Risk Assessment, etc. So normative rules are followed.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Case 3: Credit Check was done 2 days later, which is beyond the recommended 24 hours. That's a desideratum violation.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Case 3: Informing the applicant took 2 days, which is over the 48-hour recommendation. Another desideratum violation.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Case 3: Also, there's no Follow-up Call mentioned, which is another desideratum. So three desideratum issues here.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Case 2: Maybe the staff wasn't following the correct procedure, perhaps due to urgency or oversight. They might have started with Risk Assessment without realizing the Credit Check was pending. After the rejection, they might have mistakenly tried to finalize documentation, perhaps due to a system error or misunderstanding.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Case 3: The delay in Credit Check could be due to high volume or resource constraints. Similarly, the delay in informing the applicant might be due to backlogs or priority of cases. The missing Follow-up Call could be an oversight or not a priority in their process.
